meanings.definition: Having a high mass or weight in relation to volume
meanings.sent1: The rock was the densest in the collection, feeling heavy for its size.
meanings.sent2: The lead is the densest metal, making it sink quickly in water.
meanings.sent3: Carrying the densest backpack on the hike, Sarah struggled to keep up with the group.
meanings.sent4: The atmosphere in the room was densest during the tense meeting, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The densest fog I've ever seen blanketed the city, causing delays and confusion.

meanings.definition: Having parts that are close together or crowded
meanings.sent1: The densest forest in the region was home to many different animals.
meanings.sent2: The city center is the densest area, with tall buildings close together.
meanings.sent3: The densest part of the puzzle was the middle, where all the pieces seemed to fit.
meanings.sent4: The densest traffic was near the stadium, causing delays for fans trying to get to the game.
meanings.sent5: The densest cluster of stars in the sky formed a beautiful constellation.

meanings.definition: Showing or requiring great concentration or effort
meanings.sent1: The densest math problem in the test stumped many students.
meanings.sent2: The densest chapter in the book required multiple readings to understand.
meanings.sent3: Trying to follow the densest conversation at the party, I quickly got lost.
meanings.sent4: The densest workout routine pushed her to her limits, but she felt accomplished.
meanings.sent5: The densest part of the project was the research, requiring hours of focused work.
